metadata.title: CVE-2020-9430 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
In Wireshark 3.2.0 to 3.2.1, 3.0.0 to 3.0.8, and 2.6.0 to 2.6.14, the WiMaxDLMAP dissector could crash. This was addressed inplugins/epan/wimax/msg_dlmap.c by validating a length field.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-9430` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 3.2.2-1
libwireshark14 - 3.2.2-1
libwiretap11 - 3.2.2-1
libwsutil12 - 3.2.2-1
tshark - 3.2.2-1
wireshark - 3.2.2-1
wireshark-common - 3.2.2-1
wireshark-gtk - 3.2.2-1
wireshark-qt - 3.2.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.2-1').
